swiftsolutions.interfaces.input

Interface ArgumentParser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CLIArgumentParser

    public interface ArgumentParser
    An argument parser that for the Scheduling application, it allows the user to get the various input flags and their corresponding arguments that were parsed in the by the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CoresOption getCoresOption() 
      java.lang.String getFile() 
      HelpOption getHelpOption() 
      java.lang.String getOutputFile() 
      OutputOption getOutputOption() 
      int getProcessors() 
      VerboseOption getVerboseOption() 
      VisualizeOption getVisualizeOption() 
      void parse(java.lang.String[] args)
      Will parse the arguments

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        void parse(java.lang.String[] args)
    throws ArgumentFormatException
        Will parse the arguments
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments that were passed in the by user, should be processed will String.split(' '), before being passed to the ArgumentParser
        Throws:
        ArgumentFormatException - if the arguments are malformed

      • getFile

        java.lang.String getFile()
        Returns:
        the path of the graph file to be scheduled.

      • getOutputFile

        java.lang.String getOutputFile()
        Returns:
        the string name of the preferred output file the default is [INPUT]-output.dot

      • getProcessors

        int getProcessors()
        Returns:
        the CLIOption that holds the number of processors to schedule.

      • getCoresOption

        CoresOption getCoresOption()
        Returns:
        the CLIOption whether the algorithm will run in parallel mode or sequential mode, if there are 0 cores the algorithm will run in sequential mode (the default option), if there is more than 1 core specified, the algorithm will run in parallel mode with the amount of cores specified.

      • getVisualizeOption

        VisualizeOption getVisualizeOption()
        Returns:
        the CLIOption that contains whether the user wants to visualize the algorithm as it runs.

      • getOutputOption

        OutputOption getOutputOption()
        Returns:
        the CLIOption that contains whether the client wants to customize the output location.

      • getHelpOption

        HelpOption getHelpOption()
        Returns:
        the CLIOption that contains whether the user would like to display the help message (will not run the algorithm).

      • getVerboseOption

        VerboseOption getVerboseOption()
        Returns:
        the CLIOption that contains whether the user would like to see DEBUG messages during the run.
